block.p: Roni Ann Neff, a daughter of Dr. Joanna Neff and Dr. Martin Neff of Jamaica Estates, Queens, was married last evening to John Brecht McGready, the son of Mary and Thomas McGready of Ambler, Pa. Rabbi Elizabeth Bolton officiated at Port Discovery, a children's museum in Baltimore. Cantor Sally Neff, a sister of the bride, took part in the ceremony.
The bride, who graduated from Brown University, and the bridegroom, a graduate of Johns Hopkins University, received master's degrees in public health from Harvard University.

Roni Ann Neff, a daughter of Dr. Joanna Neff and Dr. Martin Neff of Jamaica Estates, Queens, was married last evening to John Brecht McGready, the son of Mary and Thomas McGready of Ambler, Pa. Rabbi Elizabeth Bolton officiated at Port Discovery, a children's museum in Baltimore. Cantor Sally Neff, a sister of the bride, took part in the ceremony.
The bride, who graduated from Brown University, and the bridegroom, a graduate of Johns Hopkins University, received master's degrees in public health from Harvard University.

Ms. Neff, 33, who is keeping her name, is the assistant director of Chana, Counseling, Helpline and Aid Network for Abused Women, a nonprofit organization in Baltimore that provides counseling and education to victims of domestic violence. Her father is a professor of nephrology at the Mount Sinai School of Medicine in Manhattan and is the chief of nephrology at the Elmhurst Hospital Center in Elmhurst, Queens. Her mother is an adjunct professor of English at St. John's University in Jamaica, Queens.

Mr. McGready, 31, is a research associate in the department of biostatistics at the Johns Hopkins School of Public Health in Baltimore. His mother is a visiting nurse at Extended Family Care Services in Ambler, where his father works as an independent investment manager.
